current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To promote research, monitoring, and observation of the
		  Arctic and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Commerce, Science, and
			 Transportation

action-instruction.#text:
Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert
			 the part printed in italic

short-title.#text:
Arctic Research, Monitoring, and Observing Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

Section 104(a) of the Arctic Research
			 and Policy Act of 1984 (

header.#text:
Duties of the
			 Arctic Research Commission

text.#text:
in paragraph (2),
			 by striking

by inserting after
			 paragraph (2) the following:
award—

grants to Federal,
				State, local, or tribal governments and academic and private organizations to
				conduct research on or related to the Arctic, including to the marine
				environment of the Arctic Ocean, its adjacent seas or associated lesser bodies
				of water; and

Section 106 of the Arctic Research and Policy
			 Act of 1984 (

in paragraph (4),
			 by striking

in paragraph (5),
			 by striking the period at the end and inserting

by adding at the
			 end the following:

enter into
				agreements with appropriate agencies or organizations to administer grants made
				pursuant to this title for Arctic research including reimbursement from funds
				of the Commission to administer such
				grants.

Section 103 of the Arctic
			 Research and Policy Act of 1984 (

external-xref.#tail:
) is amended by adding at the
			 end the following:

header.#text:
Conflicts of
			 interest; Arctic Research Commission

term.#tail:
within the meaning of section 302(j) of the
				Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act (

text.#text:
The Commission shall adopt conflict of interest and
				recusal provisions that apply to any decision by the Commission and to all
				members of the Commission as if each member of the Commission is an

external-xref.#tail:
),
				except that in addition to the disclosure requirements of paragraph (2) of such
				section 302(j), each member of the Commission shall disclose any financial
				interest or relationship in an organization or with an individual that is
				applying for funding from the Commission held by the member of the Commission,
				including an interest as an officer, director, trustee, partner, employee,
				contractor, agent, or other
				representative.

text.#text:
Subsection (e)
			 of section 401 of the Department of the Interior and Related Agencies
			 Appropriations Act, 1998 (

external-xref.#tail:
) is amended by striking paragraph
			 (5) and inserting the following:

text.#text:
The Board may
				adopt such rules of procedure and establish such committees as it deems
				necessary to carry out the purposes of this title, including the conduct of
				administrative duties between meetings.

All decisions of
				the Board shall be by majority vote of the full board in regular
				session.

term.#tail:
within the meaning of section 302(j) of the
				Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act (

text.#text:
The Board shall
				adopt conflict of interest and recusal provisions that apply to any decision by
				the Board and to all members of the Board as if each member of the Board is an

external-xref.#tail:
),
				except that in addition to the disclosure requirements of paragraph (2) of such
				section 302(j), each member of the Board shall disclose any financial interest
				or relationship in an organization or with an individual that is applying for
				funding from the Board, including an interest as an officer, director, trustee,
				partner, employee, contractor, agent, or other representative.

text.#text:
The Secretary of
				Commerce may accept funds from a source other than the Government of the United
				States to be used by the Board to carry out the Board’s
				functions.
